authorName.value: United States Department of Agriculture. Economic Development Division

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Agriculture. Economic Development Division

dsDescriptionValue.value: A household survey, conducted in Powell County, Kentucky, ascertained the ages of household members and gathered other information as well. For those households with at least one member aged 60 or over, additional questions were asked about all of the household members and about the characteristics of the housing. Longer interviews were conducted with each household member who was 60 years of age or older. Question topics included health conditions, health care, access to health services, activities, work experiences, social network, transportation, communication, community services, income, and assets.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XVII.D. Social Institutions and Behavior, Age and the Life Cycle
NACDA III. Economic Characteristics of Older Adults

distributorName.value: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

fields.value: A total of 470 households were screened for basic information on the ages and relationships of their members. Of these households, 262 were found to have at least one member 60 years of age or older, and 208 did not have such older members. A total of 398 interviews were completed with the household members 60 years or older.
Created variable labels and/or value labels.
